snippet: Ambassadors worked Thursday on a revised Syria resolution, as negotiations focused on the conditions under which President Bashar al-Assad could be asked to step down.
abstract: Security Council ambassadors reach a consensus backing an Arab League plan for political change in Syria, after dropping a specific reference to President Bashar al-Assad’s ceding of power; it is unclear whether changes would be enough to persuade all governments of the 15 member states, including Russia, which had rejected a previous resolution in October 2011, to approve resolution.

byline.contributor: Nada Bakri contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: Ambassadors worked Thursday on a revised Syria resolution, as negotiations focused on the conditions under which President Bashar al-Assad could be asked to step down.

headline.seo: U.N. Tentatively Backs a Plan for Syria
headline.main: U.N. Tentatively Backs a Plan for Syria
headline.print_headline: U.N. Tentatively Backs a Plan for Syria
